channel.title: Character length
channel.description: Was wondering how you changed the possible length of character names from 12 to say.....20....On a 317. My friend figured it out client sided, but whenever you talk....You name goes back down to 12 characters. We both think this part is server sided, so I posted here. Any help on where to search and what to search for?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 17, 2009, 11:57:12 pm[/size][hr]No one? Really.

item.title: Character length
item.dc:creator: @Setsuna Setsuna
item.description:
@Setsuna wrote:

[quote=“silabgarza, post:3, topic:289419”]its set to 12 so the player has alot of space to talk
these limits are set in the client
also like friend list max and ignore list max
alot of things are set in the client that dont need to be set by the server
im sure if u found the correct outrun byte you culd change it server sided, not a clue how u’d find it tho :)[/quote]

Well, most of it has been done…By most, I mean some. When logging in, you may type up to 20 characters (as of now) and in game it will show all 20 UNTILL you type something.

Now, the reason I want up to 20…Well, people on my server will have longer names, and 12 characters isn’t enough. 20 is perfect, though.

Read full topic

item.title: Character length
item.dc:creator: @silabgarza silabgarza
item.description:
@silabgarza wrote:

its set to 12 so the player has alot of space to talk
these limits are set in the client
also like friend list max and ignore list max
alot of things are set in the client that dont need to be set by the server
im sure if u found the correct outrun byte you culd change it server sided, not a clue how u’d find it tho

item.title: Character length
item.dc:creator: @monkeykid300 monkeykid300
item.description:
@monkeykid300 wrote:

I think it’s involved with hidden files in a client or something. I’m pretty sure you can’t do that with the server files, and I dont see a reason for doing it in the first place.

Read full topic
